programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.sub-title: Don't Bid So Close to Me
programme.desc: Barry finds an item with a connection to a rock legend at an auction in Rancho Cucamonga, while Brandi and Jarrod examine a vintage mask.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The coolest Hollywood items to find their way into the shop, including a letter terminating Marilyn Monroe's contract and the car driven by Steve McQueen in his final film.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: A look at some of the rarest items in the shop's history, including a 1969 Beach Bomb Prototype Hot Wheel and a Star Wars Boba Fett action figure.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Ashley buys a 1950s Eljer toilet for $10, leading to Seth to purchase it for double the price in order that he can destroy it with a sledgehammer and storm out of the store.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Seth chooses to stay at home and calm down after his altercation with Ashley. However, the computer system goes down, so he has no choice but to come in and repair the system.

programme.title: American Restoration
programme.desc: Rick and the team work on a tour car from the 1964 World's Fair and a vintage tool sharpener.

programme.title: American Restoration
programme.desc: Kowboy clashes with his boss when he objects to the colour of the shop uniforms, and Rick calls in an electronics expert to help him repair a rare arcade game.

programme.title: Motives & Murders
programme.desc: Detectives re-open the murder case of mother Barbara Lloyd, who was fatally stabbed in her home 30 earlier, and strive doggedly to bring her killer to belated justice.

programme.title: Unusual Suspects
programme.desc: When a five-year-old describes her mother's killer as a 'ninja', police set out to put the surprising killer behind bars.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.desc: Bubba, Kenny and Matt compete fiercely over the bargains on offer at an auction in Forth Worth.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.desc: The bidders go to Waxahachie, where Jenny makes a scandalous discovery that could prove very profitable.

programme.title: Man on Fire (2004)
programme.desc: A former US government operative battling with alcoholism is hired as a bodyguard to the daughter of a wealthy businessman in Mexico City - but when the girl is abducted, he swears to exact an explosive revenge on the kidnappers. Action thriller, starring Denzel Washington, Christopher Walken, Radha Mitchell and Dakota Fanning.

programme.title: Mock the Week
programme.desc: A 2014 edition in which host Dara O Briain and regulars Hugh Dennis and Andy Parsons are joined by Rob Beckett, Milton Jones, Romesh Ranganathan and Holly Walsh on the comedy quiz. The panellists give their take on major news stories and participate in a series of stand-up spots and improvised games.

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.desc: Rob Brydon hosts the comedy panel show in which the participants aim to hoodwink their opponents with absurd facts and plausible lies about themselves in a bid to secure a team victory. Joining regular team captains David Mitchell and Lee Mack are snooker veteran Steve Davis, actor Craig Parkinson, comedian Sara Pascoe and Strictly co-host Claudia Winkleman. They all have amazing stories to share, but whether or not they are true or works of fiction remains to be seen.

programme.title: Not Going Out
programme.desc: Lee, Lucy and the children set off in their car to catch a ferry with plenty of time to spare - or so they think. As a consequence their plans for a welcome break prove anything but stress-free. Rob Brydon guest stars, with Lee Mack and Sally Bretton.

programme.title: Asian Provocateur
programme.desc: Having spent time away from his mother during his trip to Mexico, Romesh Ranganathan reunites with her in Los Angeles, where she has been spending time with long-lost relatives, the De Silvas. However, much to Romesh's annoyance, Shanthi has thoroughly enjoyed being apart from her son. She has been pursuing her dream of becoming a film star, and is ready to snag a guest part on popular US soap General Hospital. Later, the pair plan a hip-hop tour of LA in a 'lowrider', and go undercover with a private detective, as Romesh fulfills his fantasy of reliving Beverly Hills Cop. Plus, Shanthi makes her disapproval known as the comedian drags her to one of America's biggest Comic Cons.

programme.title: Mock the Week
programme.desc: A 2014 edition in which host Dara O Briain and regulars Hugh Dennis and Andy Parsons are joined by Rob Beckett, Milton Jones, Romesh Ranganathan and Holly Walsh on the comedy quiz. The panellists give their take on major news stories and participate in a series of stand-up spots and improvised games.

programme.title: Zapped
programme.desc: Brian ingratiates himself with a touring theatrical group as he tries to reach the City of a Thousand Towers before the Super Solstice. Guest starring Sylvester McCoy.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Hurricane Man
programme.desc: The team prepare for the arrival of Hurricane Florence, which threatens millions of people in North and South Carolina, while Super Typhoon Mangkhut rages towards the Philippines.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson tries out the Lotus T125, which brings F1-style performance to the track, and an updated version of the classic Jensen Interceptor. Bob Geldof gets behind the wheel of the Reasonably Priced Car, and the trio employ all manner of second-hand military equipment to knock down a row of derelict houses, aiming to complete the job in less time than a team of demolition experts.

programme.title: Storage Hunters UK
programme.desc: Heavy D, Nat, John, Linda and the rest of the bidders are in Northampton trying to outbid each other. Sean Kelly hosts.

programme.title: Storage Hunters UK
programme.desc: Heavy D, Nat, John, Linda and the rest of the bidders are in Southampton trying to outbid each other. Sean Kelly hosts.

programme.title: Aussie Pickers
programme.desc: Series following two pickers, Lucas Callaghan and Adam McDonald, who earn a living by restoring forgotten relics to their former glory, beginning with a visit to a junkyard.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.sub-title: A Man's Home Is His Castle
programme.desc: Mike and Frank pick a family that spent 40 years building a bespoke castle, and a circus collector with a wax museum in his living room.

programme.title: Cops UK: Bodycam Squad
programme.desc: Cutting-edge documentary series following the Staffordshire Police force as they fight crime in the country's diverse and contrasting communities.

programme.title: Cops UK: Bodycam Squad
programme.desc: Police dog Jax and his handler Mat set out to catch the culprit of a spate of house burglaries in Cannock. Documentary following the work of Staffordshire police officers on the frontline as they tackle crime across Burton and Stoke-on-Trent.

programme.title: Cops UK: Bodycam Squad
programme.desc: Chaos ensues on the Saturday night shift in Stoke-on-Trent, while Rich makes a disturbing discovery in Uttoxeter. Documentary following the work of the Staffordshire Police force.

programme.title: Border Force: America's Gatekeepers
programme.desc: Officers put their lives on the line as they prepare to transfer two members of a cartel. In Laredo, a cop from Caracas, Venezuela, pleads his case for asylum in the United States.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson, Richard Hammond and James May embark on a race from London's Wembley Stadium to Milan's San Siro, the home of Italian football giants AC and Inter. A price restriction leads Jeremy to grab the keys to a Shelby Mustang GT500, which costs the equivalent of Â£35,000 in America and packs a supercharged punch of more than 650bhp. James and Richard pin their hopes on the pan-European rail network in a bid to secure the prize of tickets to a top-flight football match, with nothing but a long journey home awaiting the losers. On the test track, Jeremy puts Toyota's GT86 coupe through its paces, and its promise of entertaining rear-wheel-drive handling should put a smile on his face. Plus, singer-songwriter Amy Macdonald gets to grips with the Reasonably Priced Car.

programme.title: Scrapyard Supercar
programme.desc: Pro driver Shane Lynch allows engineer Ralph Hosier and his teams four days in the scrapyard to build contraptions capable of out-accelerating his iconic Porsche 911 Turbo. Is ingenuity and determination enough to topple one of history's greatest supercars?.

programme.title: Room 101
programme.desc: Former BBC Breakfast presenter Bill Turnbull, Death in Paradise star Ben Miller and comedienne Jo Brand compete to have their pet hates banished on the light-hearted panel show chaired by Frank Skinner. Their gripes include middle-lane drivers, personalised number plates, low-slung jeans and homeopathy.

programme.title: Room 101
programme.desc: Comedy panel show, with Strictly Come Dancing judge Craig Revel Horwood, actress Sheila Hancock and 8 Out of 10 Cats regular Jon Richardson arguing to have the things they hate consigned to the notorious room, while host Frank Skinner has the final say. Their gripes include house guests, women's toilets and dancing - and one of the celebrities even wants rid of their own brain.

programme.title: Room 101
programme.desc: Frank Skinner chairs the comedy panel show, inviting comedians Lee Mack and Ruby Wax and Hairy Biker Dave Myers to compete to have their pet hates banished for ever. Their gripes include Top Gear, new-age books and chunky chips.

programme.title: Not Going Out
programme.desc: Seven years into their marriage, Lee and Lucy face the daily onslaught of raising Charlie and his twin siblings, five-year-olds Benji and Molly. Lovably feckless father Frank remains around and close friends including world-weary Toby and uptight ice-queen Anna are still on the scene. Thankfully, Lucy's more dependable parents Geoffrey and Wendy can be relied upon when the going gets tough. However, while juggling the ongoing needs of those around him, the pair disagree about the best way to keep the romance alive. Comedy, starring Lee Mack and Sally Bretton.

programme.title: Not Going Out
programme.desc: Lucy offends father-in-law Frank by casting doubt on his ability to mind the children while she and Lee enjoy an evening out at the ballet. Sally Bretton co-stars, alongside veteran comedy performer Bobby Ball and Outnumbered's Hugh Dennis.

programme.title: Not Going Out
programme.desc: Lee, Lucy and the children set off in their car to catch a ferry with plenty of time to spare - or so they think. As a consequence their plans for a welcome break prove anything but stress-free. Rob Brydon guest stars, with Lee Mack and Sally Bretton.

programme.title: Hypothetical
programme.desc: Tom Allen, Felicity Ward, Sue Perkins and Alex Brooker are posed increasingly absurd hypothetical situations. Hosted by Josh Widdicombe and James Acaster.

programme.title: Have I Got a Bit More News for You
programme.desc: Extended edition from April 2016 in which comedian and actress Tracey Ullman became the 100th guest host of the satirical current affairs quiz, with broadcaster the Rev Richard Coles and BBC News presenter Clive Myrie joining regular team captains Ian Hislop and Paul Merton to poke fun at that week's news.

programme.title: Secrets of the Railways
programme.sub-title: The Liverpool to Manchester Line - The First Modern Railway
programme.desc: The Liverpool and Manchester Railway, which revolutionised rail travel when it opened in 1830, becoming the first railway to have a signalling system among many other things.

programme.title: Underground Worlds
programme.desc: Exploring the military headquarters built beneath Dover Castle during the Second World War and Odessa's catacombs, possibly the largest tunnel network in the world.

programme.title: True Evil: The Making of a Nazi
programme.desc: Documentary series exploring the motivations of key figures in Hitler's regime, beginning with propaganda master Josef Goebbels.

programme.title: Impossible Railways
programme.desc: Unusual rail networks designed to traverse water, including the Indian Ocean, the earthquake zones of the Bosphorus Strait and the sea cliffs of the Italian Riviera.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: The Churchills
programme.desc: Historian David Starkey profiles two of Britain's greatest wartime leaders. He begins by revealing how Winston Churchill came to write a biography of his ancestor John, who led the nation against Louis XIV of France. Starkey also explores how preparations for the Second World War were affected by the prime minister's knowledge of his 17th-century forebear's achievements.

programme.title: The Churchills
programme.desc: Historian David Starkey explains how writing a biography of his ancestor John, the first Duke of Marlborough, changed the way Winston Churchill was seen by the public and politicians, and so paved the way for his return to power. The first volume, published in 1933, reinforced the perception of him as a man past his time. But it was the second instalment, depicting John Churchill's march to the Danube and victory at Blenheim, which began to mark out Winston as the only leading politician who truly knew war.

programme.title: Secret Nazi Bases
programme.desc: A mile-and-a half of recently-excavated trenches, bunkers, barracks, and gun encasements near Pointe du Hoc, which tell a new story of D-Day.

programme.title: Steam Train Britain
programme.desc: At the East Lancashire Railway, the annual Race the Train event gets under way - with athletes of all abilities taking on the 11-mile course from Bury to Rawtenstall.

programme.title: Steam Train Britain
programme.desc: Meeting the Welsh Highland Railway's oldest volunteer fireman, 80-year-old Cedric Lodge, who has worked on the railways for 60 years. In Devon, there is a look at the Autotrain.

programme.title: Steam Train Britain
programme.desc: Great Central Railway's Scott Manley takes a rainy busman's holiday working as a guard at Bury, while a team of volunteers in Wales try to keep the line clear of overgrown plants.

programme.title: Steam Train Britain
programme.desc: At the South Devon Railway, Andy Leech and Liz Turner host afternoon tea for 44 passengers. In East Lancashire, volunteer Chandra Law takes on the new role of Stationmaster.

programme.title: Planet Earth
programme.desc: A tour of the mightiest rivers in the world, from the deep waters of Siberia's Lake Baikal, home to the world's only freshwater seal, to the wetlands downstream of Earth's tallest waterfall patrolled by frenzied piranhas. There is also footage of the lightning-quick ambush of wildebeest by crocodiles in Africa and macaque monkeys swimming underwater to catch crabs in Indonesia. Presented by David Attenborough.

programme.title: Planet Earth
programme.desc: David Attenborough looks at the world's caves, including the Lechuguilla Cave in America, which contains chambers filled with 6m-long crystals. He observes creatures in Texas and Thailand that never see daylight, and inside Deer Cave in Borneo he finds five million bats whose droppings support an entire ecosystem.

programme.title: Planet Earth
programme.desc: The nature series looks at animals that live on some of the world's highest mountains. Cameras show gelada baboons screaming to frighten off predators in Ethiopia, demoiselle cranes struggling to migrate over the Himalayas, snow leopards hunting on the peaks of Pakistan and a wild giant panda nursing a baby in a hillside cave. Presented by David Attenborough.

programme.title: Planet Earth
programme.desc: A tour of the mightiest rivers in the world, from the deep waters of Siberia's Lake Baikal, home to the world's only freshwater seal, to the wetlands downstream of Earth's tallest waterfall patrolled by frenzied piranhas. There is also footage of the lightning-quick ambush of wildebeest by crocodiles in Africa and macaque monkeys swimming underwater to catch crabs in Indonesia. Presented by David Attenborough.

programme.title: Planet Earth
programme.desc: David Attenborough looks at the world's caves, including the Lechuguilla Cave in America, which contains chambers filled with 6m-long crystals. He observes creatures in Texas and Thailand that never see daylight, and inside Deer Cave in Borneo he finds five million bats whose droppings support an entire ecosystem.

programme.title: Planet Earth
programme.desc: The nature series looks at animals that live on some of the world's highest mountains. Cameras show gelada baboons screaming to frighten off predators in Ethiopia, demoiselle cranes struggling to migrate over the Himalayas, snow leopards hunting on the peaks of Pakistan and a wild giant panda nursing a baby in a hillside cave. Presented by David Attenborough.

programme.title: Sounds of the Seventies
programme.desc: Studio and concert performances from the decade, featuring Free, Deep Purple, Jethro Tull, Yes and Dr Feelgood.

programme.title: Sounds of the Seventies
programme.desc: A collection of studio and concert performances from the decade, featuring the Carpenters, Wings, Abba and Kate Bush.

programme.title: Sounds of the Seventies
programme.desc: Selection of archive performances from the decade, including music by singer-songwriters including Carole King, James Taylor, Neil Young, Randy Newman and Don McLean.

programme.title: Sounds of the Seventies
programme.desc: A selection of archive performances from the decade, featuring the Eagles, Eric Clapton and Dire Straits.

programme.title: Secrets of Britain
programme.sub-title: Secrets of Her Majesty's Secret Service
programme.desc: The documentary series exploring the less well known side of Britain continues, with this edition exploring MI6, asking whether the shadowy world of espionage and counter-intelligence operations bear any resemblance to the James Bond novels.

programme.title: World's Greatest Palaces
programme.desc: A visit to Peles Castle in Romania, which was built in a medieval style in 1914 but is filled with modern technological innovations, including its own hydro-electric power plant.

programme.title: Chris Tarrant: Extreme Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Broadcaster Chris Tarrant continues his travels along the world's most challenging railways. Here he attempts to cross the Andes, setting off from the coast of Chile and heading for the Bolivian capital of Sucre. Along the way he traverses some of the driest and most inhospitable environments on the planet, hitches rides on unusual trains and deals with altitude sickness at more than 3,000 metres.

programme.title: Taggart
programme.desc: It looks as if ambitious politician Malcolm Innes's career has reached its zenith as he prepares to clinch a multimillion-pound investment deal that will bring thousands of jobs to Glasgow. However, the presence of angry protesters threatens to derail the project - and Innes' troubles are compounded by the fact that his own son is among their number. Cop drama, starring James Macpherson and Blythe Duff.

programme.title: London's Burning
programme.desc: Blue Watch is called out to a massive factory blaze, which grows out of control and threatens the lives of the firefighters.

programme.title: Monarch of the Glen
programme.desc: Archie's plans to return to his girlfriend in London are thwarted by the bank's efforts to reduce Glenbogle's excessive overdraft. Drama set in the Scottish Highlands, starring Richard Briers and Alastair Mackenzie.

programme.title: Garden Hopping
programme.desc: Daphne Ledward visits the stunning Rowden Gardens on Dartmoor - one of the participants in the National Gardens Scheme.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Cadfael
programme.desc: The widow of a rich merchant stirs up a tempest of lust as the men of Shrewsbury vie for her hand in marriage - and it seems one has no qualms about murdering all his rivals. Medieval mystery, starring Derek Jacobi, Terrence Hardiman, Michael Culver and Julian Firth.

programme.title: Lovejoy
programme.desc: The roguish antiques dealer returns from six months in Spain to find a guest of Lady Jane has fled Peru with a priceless Inca ring. Joanna Lumley guest stars, with Ian McShane.

programme.title: Lovejoy
programme.desc: Madly in love with one of Lady Jane's old school friends, Lovejoy finds it hard to keep his mind on work and mistakes a set of fake watercolours for the real thing. While he's off trying to put matters right, Eric takes charge of furnishing Dalrymple's stately home - with disastrous results. Joanna Lumley guest stars.

programme.title: Sharpe
programme.desc: Framed by long-time enemy Ducos for stealing Napoleon's treasures, Sharpe is abandoned by his wife Jane, and goes on the run from both the English and the French until he can prove his innocence. Period adventure, starring Sean Bean, Daragh O'Malley, Abigail Cruttenden and Cecile Paoli.

programme.title: Auf Wiedersehen, Pet
programme.desc: Work on the site ends with a bang as Barry's bike explodes, demolishing the hut and destroying most of the lads' possessions. As the smoke subsides, the crew decides who will stay on in Germany and who will head for home. Drama, starring Timothy Spall, Jimmy Nail and Gary Holton.

programme.title: Auf Wiedersehen, Pet
programme.sub-title: The Return of the Seven - Part One
programme.desc: Part one of two. The British brickies have suffered mixed fortunes since coming home from Germany and now reunite in Wolverhampton to get Barry's new home ready for his forthcoming marriage. Starring Kevin Whately, Timothy Spall, Jimmy Nail and Gary Holton.

programme.title: Ms Fisher's Modern Murder Mysteries
programme.desc: Peregrine goes undercover in a top-secret science facility after one of its employees, an old comrade of Birdie's, is found frozen to death in a crashed car.

programme.title: Father Brown
programme.desc: The priest investigates the poisoning of a former hangman, while romance is in the air for Mrs McCarthy. Fifties-set crime drama, starring Mark Williams.

programme.title: Father Brown
programme.desc: A former music hall comedian swears revenge on the priest, leaving Father Brown trapped in a derelict building. Fifties-set crime drama, starring Mark Williams.

programme.title: The Brokenwood Mysteries
programme.desc: Disaster strikes when Mike's favourite country musician Holly Collins is found electrocuted in what appears to be a drunken accident or possibly suicide. However, Mike finds a note scrawled in lipstick and begins to investigate the dysfunctional band members - Slim Fingers, Waylon Strings and Jesse James. Detective drama, starring Neill Rea.

programme.title: Murdoch Mysteries
programme.desc: An alien species intent on wiping out the human race invades Toronto, and Crabtree becomes humanity's last hope for salvation. Non-canon Halloween special.

programme.title: Life on Mars
programme.desc: Police drama, starring John Simm. Sam experiences visions that seem to suggest a return to the 21st century, but wakes to find himself still stuck in 1973. His mood lifts when he comes face to face with the younger version of a killer he arrested in 2006 and realises he has the chance to prevent a crime before it happens - but his unorthodox methods surprise colleagues at the station. With Philip Glenister and Marc Warren.

programme.title: Life on Mars
programme.desc: Sam is shocked when his mentor from 2006 arrives at the station, and offers his advice when the new recruit becomes the butt of Ray's racist jokes. Meanwhile, Gene aims to impress Supt Woolf by finding the person responsible for a spate of armed robberies, but the investigation gets off to a shaky start. Ray Emmet Brown guest stars.

programme.title: Kavanagh QC
programme.desc: A policewoman is murdered, and when a blood-soaked shoe is found in a suspect's wardrobe, it seems to be an open-and-shut case - but Kavanagh is not convinced the right man is in the dock. John Thaw stars.

programme.title: Sky News @ Breakfast
programme.desc: Join Stephen Dixon and Gillian Joseph for all the news from home and abroad, the latest sport and weather, and a review of the weekend papers.

programme.title: Super 4
programme.desc: Animated comedy adventure series featuring a gang of heroes who protect the city of Technopolis and its King Kenric against evil elements.

programme.title: Super 4
programme.desc: Animated comedy adventure series featuring a gang of heroes who protect the city of Technopolis and its King Kenric against evil elements.

programme.title: Thunderbirds Are Go
programme.desc: When a rare spider bites a scientist, Scott must locate the anti-venom carrier drone in a dense rainforest. Guest starring Peter Davison.

programme.title: Dare Master
programme.desc: Danny's challenge will see him attempt to escape from a helicopter simulator underwater. Has he got what it takes to be submerged?.

programme.title: Mr Magoo
programme.desc: Busy observing the sky in search of UFOs, Magoo accidentally finds himself wandering over to Fizz's house..

programme.title: Mr Magoo
programme.desc: Magoo, hunting for Pinkbeard's treasure, mistakes the park for an island. Fizz and Weasel are there, selling ice cream that never falls on the ground..

programme.title: Mr Magoo
programme.desc: Magoo has decided to go mountain climbing but in reality, he is climbing up a skyscraper! He mixes Fizz up with a wounded bird and ruins his plan.

programme.title: Scrambled!
programme.desc: Two hours of children's fun and entertainment.

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: Mr Bean crashes his mini into a pool of slurry and is desperate to get himself and his car - and poor Teddy - clean again!.

programme.title: Thunderbirds Are Go
programme.desc: Part two of two. International Rescue faces their most dangerous mission ever when Tracy Island comes under attack. Guest starring Lee Majors (The Six Million Dollar Man).

credits.actor: Lee Majors (The Six Million Dollar Man)

programme.title: Craig of the Creek
programme.desc: Craig of the Creek follows a young boy and his two friends as they go on adventures in a world of untamed, kid-dominated wilderness in the creek.

programme.title: James Martin's Saturday Morning
programme.desc: James is joined by guests children's author Konnie Huq, chefs Galton Blackiston and Mark Jordan, and travel writer Adrian Phillips, plus more tips from drinks expert Ewan Lacey.

programme.title: Living on the Veg
programme.desc: Henry Firth and Ian Theasby serve up their version of classic shepherd's pie, a simple recipe for fudgy chocolate cookies, sushi with two different fillings and a bakewell tart. Their guest is chef and baker Sal Dhalla, who cooks her roasted vegetable farinata.

programme.title: Save Money: Lose Weight
programme.desc: Over the past 25 years, portion sizes have increased by 100 per cent - and plates have got bigger too - none of which is good news for people's diet. With this in mind, Ranj Singh checks out the breakfast buffet to see whether people know how many calories they are piling on their plates and Sian Williams tests off-the-shelf portion-control gadgets, including smaller cutlery to help eat more slowly. Plus, two more diets are put to the test - the Metabolism Reset Diet, based around a detox for the liver, and Bosh! Healthy Vegan, which means ditching the junk.

programme.title: Six Nations Live
programme.desc: Italy v Scotland (Kick-off 2.15pm). Jill Douglas presents coverage of the opening game in the third round of fixtures, which takes place at the Stadio Olimpico in Rome. Both sides are without a win so far, with Italy showing some improvement against France after a heavy defeat to Wales, and Scotland producing spirited displays in narrow losses to Ireland and England. With analysis from Ian McGeechan, Maggie Alphonsi, Gareth Thomas and Marco Bortolami, and commentary by Miles Harrison, Scott Hastings and Ben Kay.

programme.title: Tipping Point
programme.desc: Compilation of some of the most dramatic endgames from the arcade-themed quiz show hosted by Ben Shephard, in which the last contestant standing competes for a Â£10,000 jackpot.

programme.title: Despicable Me 3 (2017)
programme.desc: Dismissed from the Anti-Villain League after botching a mission, Gru sets off to meet his long-lost twin brother. Animated sequel, with the voices of Steve Carell, Kristen Wiig and Trey Parker.

programme.title: Ant & Dec's Saturday Night Takeaway
programme.desc: The popular duo return with a new series of the entertainment show, in which Ant v Dec goes global. This series will feature the biggest ever giveaway in British TV history and a finale coming from a very special location. In the first episode, Stephen Mulhern joins Ant and Dec in the studio.

programme.title: The Voice UK
programme.desc: Emma Willis hosts the first of this year's Battle Rounds in the singing contest. Coaches will.i.am, Sir Tom Jones, Olly Murs and Meghan Trainor all return to their infamous red chairs as the acts they have chosen from the blind auditions go head to head and fight for their place on their coach's team. The singers that impress their coach the most remain in the competition with a chance of winning a recording contract. Will those that aren't so lucky be stolen by another coach or will they be going home?.

programme.title: Live Boxing
programme.desc: Brad Foster v Lucien Reid. Coverage of the rematch for the British and Commonwealth Super Bantamweight titles, which takes place at the York Hall in London's Bethnal Green. The fighters shared the spoils in a majority draw when they met here five months ago, with one judge giving Reid the nod and the other two scoring it even. This time around both men will be determined to maintain their unbeaten record and ensure there is a decisive outcome in their favour.

programme.desc: Make way for the unapologetically unique Yungblud, as we discover the must-have rock acts on his rider - with big ones from Paramore, Green Day & Blink 182, plus some of his own.

programme.title: Showdown: Drake Vs Post Malone
programme.desc: Two of rap's biggest stars Drake & Post Malone go head to head in a showdown of their biggest hits! Will Drake's 'Hotline Bling' have Post Malone going in 'Circles'? Stay tuned & find out.

programme.title: That's My Jam: Heavy Hook Ups
programme.desc: DJ Shortee Blitz presents the urban scene's hottest heavyweight collaborations. Expect bangers from Jay Z and Kanye, Eminem and Akon, Sia and Sean Paul, Snoop and Pharrell and many more.

programme.title: The Saturday Hotmix!
programme.desc: An exclusive, non-stop mix of the hottest songs to soundtrack your Saturday evening!.

programme.title: Hit After Hit
programme.desc: Nothing but the biggest hits by your favourite stars back to back.

programme.title: How Do They Do It?
programme.desc: The complex technological processes involved in mining rare gemstones, crafting classic cowboy boots and building large-scale road-sweepers.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike Brewer seeks to get his hands on an expensive BMW 2002tii, and if he is to stay on budget, he must take a gamble on a model that has not been started for 17 years.

programme.title: Outback Truckers
programme.desc: Nick and Jo face ongoing mechanical problems as their fully loaded road-train's engine fails. Plus, breakdowns and engine problems push Steve behind schedule in the Outback.

programme.title: American Chopper
programme.sub-title: On the Road - European Tour: Part One
programme.desc: Part one of two. The OCC crew heads to Europe for a family holiday, taking in the sights in London, and heading out on the open road in Ireland on bikes.

programme.title: Fantomworks
programme.desc: Gary wants to restore a 1964 Mercedes 230SL, but his tight budget launches Dan into a headlong battle. Meanwhile, Al wants to restore his father's GTO.

programme.title: Dirty Jobs
programme.desc: Mike Rowe visits an operation to clean up a hazardous oil spill in Alaska, before helping to pull a car from a frozen lake in Minnesota.

programme.title: How It's Made
programme.desc: Developments in the manufacture of patterned glass panels and road cases, and how stop-frame animated films are made.

programme.title: How It's Made
programme.desc: Developments in the production of industrial wire ropes, living walls and large-format cameras.

programme.title: Deadliest Catch
programme.desc: Elliot Neese leaves the crab-fishing fleet, despite having a boat worth $1.5million and a king crab quota greater than any other captain in the fleet.

programme.title: Supercar Superbuild
programme.desc: An in-depth insight into the mechanical capabilities and basic building processes behind BMW's distinctive Mini range.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike Brewer searches for the Bond Bug, a three-wheeled 1970s British sports car, hoping that if he can acquire one his expert mechanic Edd China can make it roadworthy once more.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike Brewer settles for a Volkswagen T2 panel van after his budget proves too tight for a classic Camper, and mechanic Edd China agrees to ambitious plans concerning its renovation.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike Brewer tracks down a BMW Isetta bubble car, but Edd China finds the small vehicle difficult to repair and the pair's chances of turning a profit are put in jeopardy.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Edd China and Mike Brewer set the challenge to find the ultimate bug-out vehicle that would ceaselessly run, and decide on the Land Rover Series IIA.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike Brewer and Edd China take advantage of an iconic three wheeler, the Messerschmitt KR200, as it is about to celebrate its 60th birthday.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike Brewer sources a 181 Thing from a collector, but is forced to dig deep for the purchase, meaning there is not much money left in the kitty for Edd China's repair job.

programme.title: Hunting Hitler
programme.desc: An eyewitness in Spain offers the team a key clue in their search for Hitler's escape route from Europe. In Argentina, the hunt for his U-boat continues.

programme.title: Treasure Quest: Snake Island
programme.desc: The treasure hunters make a new discovery, and a run-in with a jaguar leads to another revelation. However, the new path has tragic consequences for Captain Keith.

programme.title: Outback Opal Hunters
programme.desc: New team the Bushmen clash with opal thieves raiding one of their mines. The Cookes hack an old digging machine, while the Fire Crew hunt for a new deposit of rare black opal.

programme.title: Outback Opal Hunters
programme.desc: Bushmen Rod and Les risk their lives re-opening a long-abandoned mine. New team the Young Guns goes deep underground for the first time, hunting pineapple opal.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike Brewer gets his hands on a valuable 1995 Ford Escort RS Cosworth, hoping new mechanic Ant Anstead can restore the 227hp engine's famous 'fizz'.

programme.title: Born Mucky: Life on the Farm
programme.desc: Ian's cattle face an important day as they are tested for bovine tuberculosis. Ally uses Viking woodcraft skills to build a fence for his new camping side business.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters
programme.desc: Drew Pritchard visits a dealer specialising in house clearances, and in Sheffield spots industrial furniture at a 19th-century factory. Later, he finds old punk collectable.

programme.title: EFL on Quest
programme.desc: Colin Murray introduces a round-up of goals and highlights from the English Football League, including Bristol City v West Bromwich Albion and Leeds United v Reading.

programme.title: Outback Opal Hunters
programme.desc: Bushmen Rod and Les risk their lives re-opening a long-abandoned mine. New team the Young Guns goes deep underground for the first time, hunting pineapple opal.

programme.title: The Lady Killers
programme.desc: How a love triangle between two sisters and one of their husbands led to a shocking murder when Sabah Khan stabbed sibling Saima Khan in Luton in 2006. Here, detectives review the case that proved love can ruin any family bond.

programme.title: Forensic Detectives
programme.desc: The challenges faced by investigators trying to catch the most elusive of murderers - those who choose their victims at random.

programme.title: Crime Stories
programme.sub-title: Cary Stayner: The Yosemite Park Murderer
programme.desc: Profile of Cary Stayner, a serial killer convicted of killing four women in 1999 in Mariposa County near Yosemite, California. His first two victims, Carole Sund and Silvina Pelosso, were retrieved from the boot of a car, burned beyond recognition and had to be identified using dental records. The third was Carole's daughter Juli and the remaining victim was naturalist Joie Ruth Armstrong.

programme.title: Murder Comes to Town
programme.desc: The case of 25-year-old waitress Zilpha Lowery who vanished in July 1993. Foul play was immediately suspected as rumours of Lowery's fate spread through her North Carolina town and tied her to another mysterious disappearance. Her body was found with its skull crushed several months later, but it would be another 13 years before a tip led detectives out of state to find their man.

programme.title: Most Evil
programme.desc: The relative rarity of female killers is examined. With 90 per cent of murders committed by men, the programme asks what motivates women to commit murder, looking at the famous cases of Marybeth Tinning, Cathy Wood, Gwendolyn Graham, Susan Smith and Aileen Wuornos.

programme.title: Animal Cops Phoenix
programme.desc: A look at the impact of Phoenix's location in the Sonoran desert, as well as how it affects the animals that live there.

programme.title: Bondi Vet: Coast to Coast
programme.desc: Dr Alex Hynes tries to treat a Labrador-staffy cross that has been attacked by another dog. Plus, carers attend to an American bulldog which has eaten a whole packet of macadamia nuts.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: A bride-to-be who has planned a fairy-themed wedding hopes to find a dress to match. Plus, Vicki returns for a fitting.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.sub-title: A Dress Like None the Rest
programme.desc: A model who has worn many wedding dresses for photo shoots fears the gown for her own big day will not feel special as a result. A man helps his daughter find the right dress.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: UK
programme.desc: Nana is Ghanaian royalty and is running out of time to find her wedding gown, while Claire seeks something simple for her Windsor Castle wedding.

programme.title: Bondi Vet
programme.desc: Chris Brown has an all-night marathon in a canine maternity ward, and a rabbit is hit with a bad case of heatstroke.

programme.title: Bondi Vet: Coast to Coast
programme.desc: Series featuring vets from locations all over Australia, including Dr Peter Ricci, Dr Alex Hynes, Dr Kate Adams, Dr Lewis Hunt and Dr Danni Dusek. In this episode, Dr Kate discovers dachshund Gary has a life-threatening condition. Dr Alex is under pressure to deliver 12 puppies, and Dr Peter performs surgery on a lion.

programme.title: My 600lb Life
programme.sub-title: Rena and Lee's Story - Part One
programme.desc: Part one of two. Since meeting at a bariatric rehab centre in 2006, Lee and Rena's weight has skyrocketed. The couple are now taking a second attempt to save their lives.

programme.title: My 600lb Life
programme.sub-title: Rena and Lee's Story - Part Two
programme.desc: Part two of two. Since meeting at a bariatric rehab centre in 2006, Lee and Rena's weight has skyrocketed. The couple are now taking a second attempt to save their lives.

programme.title: My 600lb Life
programme.desc: A grieving mother has gastric bypass surgery to reduce her weight, but now has to confront the emotional issues that cause her to overeat.

programme.title: My 600lb Life: Where Are They Now?
programme.desc: Olivia strives to meet her target weight as she lives by herself for the first time. Meanwhile, James fights to reach his goal of skin surgery.

programme.title: Disappeared
programme.desc: The case of Tyarra Williams, who vanished in January 2016. Tips suggested the 19-year-old frm North Carolina may have fallen prey to human trafficking.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Atlanta
programme.desc: A Southern belle wants to shed her pageant image, while a tomboy bride hopes to be the picture of elegance.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Atlanta
programme.desc: Bride Jenny and her fashion-diva bridesmaid battle over whether to wear lace, while Gretchen returns to the salon to try on her custom-made gown.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Atlanta
programme.desc: Country girl Hannah comes searching for a dress to match her cowgirl boots, while Leslie knows exactly what she wants - but unfortunately, her mum holds the purse strings.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Atlanta
programme.desc: A Star Wars-obsessed bride wants to look like Princess Leia, while a Southern belle wants a groovy dress for her hippie-themed wedding.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Atlanta
programme.desc: Jessica wants to incorporate camouflage into her wedding gown, while Kaleeta - who hates shopping - needs help to find her dream dress.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Atlanta
programme.desc: ABC News bride Linsey is on a mission to find her dream wedding gown, but everything her friends and family suggest fails to meet her expectations.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Atlanta
programme.desc: Bride-to-be Jessie and her grandmother struggle to see eye to eye regarding the price range of her perfect gown, while Maria seeks her sisters' approval at her final fitting.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Atlanta
programme.desc: Tracy is on the hunt for a fun, flirty gown for her forthcoming Las Vegas wedding, while second-time bride Isabel selects a dress without her daughters' approval.

programme.title: Long Island Medium
programme.desc: Theresa Caputo meets a woman who claims to be another medium, while Larry goes for a check-up after surviving a brain tumour.

programme.title: Long Island Medium
programme.desc: Victoria shocks her parents by dropping out of school, and Theresa holds a group reading involving a man who lost friends in the military.

programme.title: Hoarding: Buried Alive
programme.sub-title: My Teeth Are Lost in the Pile
programme.desc: Kyle and Lynn's relationship suffered due to her hoarding, which is now putting them at risk of losing their home. This programme follows their efforts to restore order.

programme.title: People Magazine Investigates
programme.desc: In 1998, a gifted Philadelphia graduate student was found murdered in her bed. The hunt for her killer forced police to reevaluate a series of unsolved crimes, turning the city upside down.

programme.title: Faking It: Tears of a Crime
programme.desc: The murder of 16-year-old Bristol student Becky Watts. When she vanished in February 2015, suspicion fell on her step-brother Nathan Matthews and his partner Shauna Hoare. Experts analyse police interviews for the clues that proved compelling.

programme.title: Charles Manson: The Final Words
programme.desc: Documentary combining the final interviews with the cult leader prior to his death with personal accounts from former followers to uncover the reasons behind the infamous murders.
